name: Cubmarine (cigarettesandcode)
description:
You are working in a submarine and many things can happen there; water that drips from the ceiling isn't one of the acceptable ones.

Cubmarine is a short old-school text-adventure with several different endings which depend on the decisions you make. Initially, it was only meant to be a test-project for starting to learn a new programming language, but with help from Daniel da Silva it quickly developed into a small game. (He also made the Linux Port possible - yeah!)

You can also run the game on a Raspberry Pi if that's something you're interested in - just download the source code and compile for your needs. Or do whatever else you want with it, I honestly don't care.

Key-Features:
- that awesome 1980's feeling you love and missed so much
- 4 endings you probably will find
- 1 ending you probably won't find
- references to dumb memes you even forgot existed
- guaranteed high-speed performance on every system (even on a potato if you somehow manage to run the game on it)
- two colors and a ton of words
